sentence3: He set it to the side and went to get a soda to complete his meal.
sentence4: When he got back the torta was gone and crumbs were left instead.

sentence1: Rory began feeling sluggish after his thirtieth birthday.
sentence2: It had been years since he'd played sports or worked out.
sentence3: He got a new job across town.
sentence4: To save money, he usually walked instead of taking the bus.

sentence1: At school, Charles stood around talking to his girlfriend Naomi.
sentence2: A bully nearby threw pebbles at Charles.
sentence3: Naomi suggested they talk somewhere else.
sentence4: Charles told him to stop and the bully said let's fight at 3 o'clock.

sentence1: Sue entered a nacho eating contest.
sentence2: Nachos are her favorite food so she thought she could do well.
sentence3: Sue started off slow to pace herself.
sentence4: She then upped the ante.

sentence1: I wanted to save a little money at the store.
sentence2: I knew the kids wanted doritos.
sentence3: I saw a bag of doritos styled generic chips.
sentence4: They were only a dollar, so I bought them.

sentence1: Cynthia was a customer support rep for a large company.
sentence2: She could only submit tickets and empathize with the callers.
sentence3: One day, she noticed all her the tickets were automatically deleted.
sentence4: Cynthia keeps answering the phone, as long as she's paid.

sentence1: Marco and his friends were watching a movie.
sentence2: Someone suggested that they make popcorn.
sentence3: Marco put a bag in the microwave.
sentence4: Then, he went back to hang out with his friends.

sentence1: John wanted some barbecue chicken.
sentence2: He had some chicken but no barbecue.
sentence3: So he went too the store to get barbecue.
sentence4: John went home to cook the chicken.

sentence1: My work made a mistake with my paycheck.
sentence2: They shorted me by one day.
sentence3: It happened at a bad time.
sentence4: My rent is due.

sentence1: Margaret made a costume for a Halloween party.
sentence2: She worked very hard on it.
sentence3: When she got to the party, she saw someone had made a similar costume.
sentence4: The two started to talk.

sentence1: Owen was an aspiring author.
sentence2: He had written several letters to his favorite local newspaper.
sentence3: One morning he was reading said paper as he ate cereal.
sentence4: Suddenly he noticed his own words right on the page.

sentence1: Sarah makes the best chicken and broccoli casserole.
sentence2: All her friends love it.
sentence3: This time she tried something different.
sentence4: When she took it for potluck, no one ate it.

sentence1: I sent flowers and a big cookie to my wife for V Day.
sentence2: I sent cookies to my daughter.
sentence3: I sent these items to work.
sentence4: Their colleagues were impressed.

sentence1: James was meeting a date at the coffee shop.
sentence2: It was half an hour past their meeting time.
sentence3: James thought for sure he had been stood up.
sentence4: He suddenly got a phone call.

sentence1: Frank is a teacher who is ready for it to be summer.
sentence2: He has two more weeks until school is over and he's struggling.
sentence3: He thinks of creative ways to make time go by faster.
sentence4: He gives his students a daily project to work on.

sentence1: Will had a recurring dream about being trapped in a cellar.
sentence2: After several times of dreaming this, Will thought he needed help.
sentence3: Will talked with a psychologist, telling him about the dream.
sentence4: Will was relieved to hear the doctor's response.

sentence1: Lisa had never flown.
sentence2: She was always afraid to fly because her uncle died on a plane.
sentence3: One year her family was taking a trip to Germany.
sentence4: She was reluctant to take the trip, but her family made her feel safe.

sentence1: Neil flew into Chiang Mai, Thailand.
sentence2: He booked a jungle tour.
sentence3: They took him to ride elephants and see jungle tribes!
sentence4: Then he shopped for jungle souvenirs.

sentence1: Mindy didn't like her work at all.
sentence2: She was grumpy when she woke up, at work and back home at night.
sentence3: She decided it was time to change her life.
sentence4: She decided to move to a new city.

sentence1: Tim was with his family on a trip.
sentence2: They went to a gemstone mine.
sentence3: After learning about the place they were allowed to mine.
sentence4: Tim found several nice rocks.

sentence1: Summer had just ended.
sentence2: The leaves were changing colors.
sentence3: Some fell onto the ground.
sentence4: I raked them into a pile.

sentence1: Tori refused to eat broccoli.
sentence2: Her mother could not convince her to eat it.
sentence3: Finally, her mother offered her twenty-five cents to try it.
sentence4: Tori finally gave in and ate the broccoli.

sentence1: Jeff loved ice cream.
sentence2: He ate it every night.
sentence3: He got really fat.
sentence4: Jeff couldn't get a girlfriend.

sentence1: The delivery man delivered a small package.
sentence2: I found out that it was my meal prep package.
sentence3: I opened it and started to prepare one of the dishes.
sentence4: The food was fresh and contained several ingredients.

sentence1: I was playing music in my apartment.
sentence2: The neighbors came and said there was too much noise.
sentence3: Slighted, I turned the music up louder.
sentence4: They called the police.

sentence1: James recently met a woman who he really liked.
sentence2: They had their first date at the beach near his home.
sentence3: After their first date they became inseparable.
sentence4: He plans on proposing to her in the near future.

sentence1: I sit on the bench in front of our building to read.
sentence2: One day a woman came by and asked what I was reading.
sentence3: I showed her the book.
sentence4: She looked at and said goodbye in a friendly manner.
